input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where and how the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

fastq.description: Directory containing fastq input files. May contain fastq files directly or directories name barcodeXX relating to independent samples
fastq.help_text: If directories named \"barcode*\" are found under the `--fastq` directory the data is assumed to be multiplex and each barcode directory will be processed independently. If `.fastq(.gz)` files are found under the `--fastq` directory the sample is assumed to not be multiplexed. In this second case `--samples` should be a simple name rather than a CSV file.

samples.description: CSV file with columns named `barcode` and `sample_name`. (or simply a sample name for non-multiplexed data)

out_dir.description: Directory for output of all user-facing files.

sanitize_fastq.description: Use additional heuristics to identify barcodes from file paths
sanitize_fastq.help_text: Enabling this option will group together files into samples by the presence of strings of the form `barcodeXXX` present in filenames, rather than simply files grouped into directories (as output by MinKNOW and the Guppy basecaller).

benchmark.description: Switch between standard or benchmark modes
benchmark.help_text: In benchmarking mode the calls made using the pipeline will be evaluated against the supplied truthset. The report will be populated with the results. Paths to truthset files are set within the config file, and may be URLs or absolute paths.

target_bedfile.description: BED file, SVs will only be called in these regions

benchmarkUseTruthsetBed.description: Calculate benchmarks using the truthset BED rather than an auto-generated bedfile covering reference contigs

truthset_vcf.description: The `truth` VCF to use for benchmarking

truthset_index.description: The `truth` VCF index to use for benchmarking

truthset_bed.description: The `truth` VED to use for benchmarking

max_bp.description: Maximum BP to use per sample (0 is all)

min_len.description: Minimum read length to retain for calling

max_len.description: Maximum read length to retain for calling

min_sv_length.description: Minimum SV length to retain after calling

max_sv_length.description: Maximum SV length to retain after calling

min_read_support.description: Minimum read support required to call a SV

min_read_support_limit.description: Minimum read depth needed to retain an SV call

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

threads.description: Max number of threads to use for each process.
